meanings.definition: An oval or round object laid by a female bird, reptile, fish, or invertebrate.
meanings.sent1: The bird sat on her egg to keep it warm.
meanings.sent2: I cracked an egg into the frying pan for breakfast.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken sit on the egg? To keep it cozy!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled out like a cracked egg, spreading joy.
meanings.sent5: The fragile eggshell protected the new life inside.

meanings.definition: To cover with beaten egg before cooking.
meanings.sent1: She likes to egg the chicken before frying it.
meanings.sent2: The recipe says to egg the pastry before baking.
meanings.sent3: He tried to egg the salad, but it just made a mess!
meanings.sent4: The chef's secret to a golden crust is to egg the bread.
meanings.sent5: Egg the meat before grilling to seal in the flavors.

meanings.definition: To encourage or incite someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: I will egg you on to finish the race strong!
meanings.sent2: The coach decided to egg the team to victory with a pep talk.
meanings.sent3: His friends tried to egg him on to jump into the pool.
meanings.sent4: The crowd's cheers seemed to egg the performer to do an encore.
meanings.sent5: The supportive words from her family egged her on to pursue her dreams.
